Dear all,

The human brain has different areas that solve different kind of=

problems. My question is if you think it is a good idea to try
encouraging=
 a network to divide a problem into smaller sub problems
and then solve it.=


This is my thought:

- Let say that every neuron has 3 coordinates (x,y,z=
) 
- Assuming that you can tell which neurons were performing well in one
e=
poch 
(Backprop run, network weights that didn't have to be changed much et=
c)
- All those nodes should "gravitate" towards each other
- Nodes close to=
 each other have a higher probability to form a
connection.

The result sho=
uld be a network that in someway tries to be modular.
Next step should be t=
o see if it is possible to do individual training
of different areas of the=
 network.

I mean when you learn math and when you are painting, different =
areas
of the brain is active.

Comments?

Br,
Christofer
